items.title: How have you honoured the victims of Bondi? Share your images and stories

items.title: Australia defeats words with actions to outclass England and romp to Ashes glory

items.summary: Influencers push a false promise of easy money and a better life in Australia with a Work and Holiday Visa, inspiring young Indonesians to take extreme measures to chase an almost unrealisable dream.

items.title: AHPRA puts practice conditions on neurosurgeon Greg Malham
items.summary: Doctor Greg Malham, who was terminated from a Melbourne private hospital following an ABC investigation into his behaviour, will have to undertake mentoring sessions to continue practising.

items.title: Former police officer claims he warned of Bondi terror attack a decade ago
items.summary: Steve Buttel says he told his bosses "it was only a matter of time" before there would be a terror attack on Bondi's Jewish community.

items.title: Patients allege rape, beatings and staff cover-ups at Brisbane mental hospital in damning report
items.summary: Wolston Park closed in 2001, but, for decades, it has been at the centre of disturbing allegations of abuse and chemical restraint. Now, patients' stories have been published alongside a report.

items.title: ASIO's 'grim reality' as it picks over Bondi intelligence gaps
items.summary: As Australia's intelligence agencies look back over how the Bondi attackers were missed, a "grim reality" of their jobs confronts the country.

items.title: Tougher hate speech laws used four times before government vowed to rework them
items.summary: Strenthened federal hate speech laws that the government held up as evidence it acted on antisemitism have been used four times since February, with it now conceding they do not go far enough.

items.title: Weekly news quiz: An adventurous koala, a chaotic Lionel Messi tour and a Trump blockade
items.summary: Another week, another quiz. Are you ready to test yourself?

items.title: Trump Media group buys fusion power company for $9bn
items.summary: The US president's company also operates a number of cryptocurrency-related financial products and owns social media platform Truth Social.

items.title: Extra $42.6 million for mental health support after Bondi terror attack
items.summary: A temporary mental health centre will be set up in Bondi offering free walk-in services to help Australians grieving and traumatised by the deadly terror attack.

items.title: Police called to Mordialloc again after reports of assaults near pier
items.summary: Police have again been called to the Melbourne bayside suburb of Mordialloc, a day after reports of a brawl involving more than 100 teenagers.

items.title: Yoshua Bengio explains why AI could become a threat to humanity
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.title: One week on, how well is the social media ban working?
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.title: Signs the algal bloom that's devastated our beaches could be diminishing
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.title: Security experts say hate speech crackdown may 'constrict' preachers promoting violence
items.summary: Experts say the federal government must actually use new laws being finalised this summer to crack down on hate speech and so-called "hate preachers" in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Australian man Lamar Ahchee sentenced to 12 years in prison for role in Bali cocaine-smuggling plot
items.summary: An Australian man is sentenced to 12 years in a Bali prison for his role in trafficking cocaine into the country in Lindt chocolate wrappers.

items.title: Inquest hears nothing could have been done in 'rare, tragic' baby's death at Atherton Hospital
items.summary: An inquest has been examining the death of a newborn at Atherton Hospital and whether the care the mother and baby received were in any way responsible.

items.title: Queensland mother accused of staging drowning death of four-year-old son committed to stand trial
items.summary: Tara Maree Richardson is charged with the 2021 murder of Tarrin O'Sullivan, with prosecutors alleging the boy was killed before being placed into the water at Munbura, south of Mackay.

items.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Tropical disease melioidosis rebranded 'melio' after record-breaking year for soil-borne bacteria
items.summary: Cases of melioidosis in Cairns have set records this year, and authorities are uncertain why. But one survivor has joined a campaign to start a conversation about safety as the rains return in the north.

items.title: Snicko circus distracts in Adelaide as Australia sends England sliding towards Ashes oblivion
items.summary: The circus comes to town in Adelaide with technological madness marring a second day which, more importantly, saw England wilt again and Australia tighten its grip on the Ashes.

items.title: Lucky few Zone RV customers rejoice after receiving caravans from collapsed manufacturer
items.summary: People who fully paid before the company collapsed can receive their vans if they pay an extra fee, while the majority of customers remain in limbo.

items.title: How to handle awkward comments and conversations this Christmas
items.summary: While your Instagram feed says the holidays are about joy and love, for many people Christmas is a time of managing tricky family members, inappropriate comments and probing questions.

items.title: Christmas Day predicted to be scorcher in Perth with top of 39 degrees predicted
items.summary: With only seven more sleeps until the big day, Western Australia looks like being the hottest capital city in the nation this Christmas.

items.title: Ashes 2025: DRS madness in Adelaide Test as Jamie Smith survives, then gets out after shambolic reviews
items.summary: A series of strange decisions by umpires further erodes any trust in the DRS process as day two at the Adelaide Oval devolves into "shambles" and "chaos".

items.title: Victorian Government details 'value capture' mechanisms to fund Suburban Rail Loop east
items.summary: The Victorian government turns to developer contributions and car park levies as it tries to raise more than $10 billion in funding for the first stage of the Suburban Rail Loop.

items.title: 'Children aren't born antisemitic': Education review aims to make Jewish students safer
items.summary: The focus will turn from the threats outside the gate to those some critics say are embedded within education from a lack of Holocaust education to the harassment of Jewish students at universities.

items.title: US approves largest ever multi-billion-dollar arms package for Taiwan
items.summary: The United States has approved its largest ever weapons package for Taiwan which is under increasing military pressure from China.

items.title: NT government's tourism permit for Lorella Springs Wilderness Park 'in excess of its powers', federal court hears
items.summary: The future of an isolated tourism hotspot home to stunning waterfalls and ancient rock art is uncertain following a Federal Court hearing in Darwin.

items.title: Firefighters put out 'ferocious' 30m tall blaze at Forster oyster business
items.summary: A NSW oyster grower is left reeling after tens of thousands of dollars' worth of equipment went up in flames just a week away from Christmas.

items.title: Indigenous community mourns Stolen Generation mission site destroyed by fire
items.summary: Parts of WA's Indigenous community are in mourning, while others have mixed feelings, after a former mission where members of the Stolen Generation were institutionalised was partly destroyed in a bushfire.

items.title: South Coast WA towns brace for booming angler numbers as West Coast fishery closes
items.summary: South Coast towns are calling for more funding to cope with a surge of recreational fishers as the region prepares to shut down recreational and commercial fishing.

items.title: Optus slapped with 21 recommendations following Triple Zero outage linked to two deaths
items.summary: Kerry Schott's report into the Triple Zero outage debacle increases pressure on Optus to implement 21 recommendations, some of them "urgent", and highlights numerous errors.

items.title: Humbled Albanese shifts gear as Jewish community's anger builds
items.summary: This was a humbled prime minister. Showing contrition, some regret, and an acknowledgement more could have been done.

items.title: Sam Kerr scores the winner as Chelsea makes it through to Women's Champions League quarterfinals
items.summary: Sam Kerr heads in the winner as Chelsea secures a spot in the Women's Champions League quarterfinals.

items.title: Ashes 2025: Alex Carey's DRS controversy leaves experts questioning use of 'Snicko' technology
items.summary: The use of "Snicko" in the Ashes is questioned after yet another DRS controversy in the third Ashes Test frustrates England and helps Alex Carey to a Test century.

items.title: The best films of 2025: From gory horror to sugar-rush animation
items.summary: From Australian-made gore to sugar-rush animation, here are the films that had our critics seated and watching this year.

items.title: Netwealth strikes ASIC deal to compensate First Guardian investors
items.summary: Financial services company Netwealth has agreed to pay more than $100 million to more than 1,000 clients who invested in the failed First Guardian super fund through its platform.

items.title: Two years out from FIFA's equal prize goal, the men's tournament's pool will be six times that of the women's
items.summary: FIFA has announced a record prize money pool for the 2026 men's World Cup, but the figures are dwarfed by the riches on offer for the biggest club competitions, and fly in the face of the deadline for parity with the women's tournament.

items.title: Albanese announces tougher hate speech laws in wake of Bondi terror attack
items.summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has announced sweeping reforms to crack down on antisemitism in the wake of the deadly terror attack on Sydney's Jewish community.

items.title: Coalition 'flabbergasted' by Labor's response to calls for Bondi royal commission into antisemitism
items.summary: The opposition criticises the government for brushing aside calls for a royal commission into antisemitism as pressure mounts on Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to act in the wake of the deadly terror attack on Sydney's Jewish community.

items.title: Woodside chief executive Meg O'Neill resigns in move to BP
items.summary: The chief executive of Perth-based oil and gas producer Woodside, Meg O'Neill, resigns from the company effective immediately in order to take up the same role at BP.

items.title: NT Police doubles reward for information on missing mother-of-two Angie Fuller to $500k
items.summary: NT Police has doubled its reward for information related to the disappearance of Angie Fuller, almost three years after her suspected murder in outback Australia.

items.title: Ashes 2025: Ben Stokes cramps, DRS woes continue as Pat Cummins, Nathan Lyon claim wickets on dominant day two at Adelaide Oval
items.summary: Ben Stokes has dragged his battered, cramping body to the close on day two of the third Ashes Test, with the tourists chances of victory hanging by a thread.

items.title: Crime in Victoria continues to rise, driven by an increase in thefts and family violence
items.summary: The latest statistics show crime in Victoria is at its highest level since the Crime Statistics Agency started keeping records 20 years ago.

items.title: Outback Farm stars finish first barley harvest at Central Australian farm
items.summary: Amid the red dirt, termite mounds and buffel grass, the first barley harvest is finished at Central Australia's Athelle Outback Hideaway.

items.title: Broken Hill arts community left in the lurch following funding cuts
items.summary: Malyangapa Baaka Wiimpatja artist Leroy Johnson says the axing of an arts grant, which he is the last recipient of, has left the Broken Hill arts community feeling unsupported.

items.title: Oscars to stream exclusively on YouTube from 2029, academy says
items.summary: In a seismic shift for one of television's marquee events, the Academy Awards will depart US broadcaster ABC and begin streaming on YouTube, beginning in 2029.

items.title: Aged care centres urged to budget for live entertainment to provide human connection
items.summary: A performer and an advocate for older Australians are worried that live entertainment for aged care residents is on the decline as other leisure activities, such as virtual reality, gain popularity.

items.title: Gun control debate heats up over proposed NSW firearm cap in wake of Bondi Beach shooting
items.summary: Firearm restrictions proposed by the New South Wales government in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack would go far to reduce the growing number of guns across the state and prevent further harm, a gun control researcher says.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting updates: Sussan Ley calls on Albanese to recall parliament to address antisemitism — as it happened
items.summary: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley calls on Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to recall parliament to address the issue of antisemitism in the community, in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Outback town has 'zero' rental stock as new copper mine is set to increase housing pressure
items.summary: When Leylanie moved her family back to her home town a year ago, she did not expect to be spending this Christmas still living out of a motel.

items.title: Prostate cancer survivor with incontinence speaks out about lack of men's sanitary bins
items.summary: Prostate cancer survivor Mick Barrett is calling on businesses to consider installing rubbish bins inside men's bathrooms to help those with incontinence.

items.title: Bodyline bowler Harold Larwood pummeled Australia — but was pipped by pomegranates
items.summary: Flying fruit pips are less menacing than the cork and leather cricket balls that Harold Larwood hurled at Australian batsmen during the infamous Bodyline series, but a showdown between the English fast bowler and a disgruntled crowd that was allegedly armed with pomegranate seeds is part of the rich story of Ashes acrimony.

items.title: England fume as Snicko operator admits error in Alex Carey reprieve in third Ashes Test
items.summary: Snicko's boss admits an operator error dudded England out of the wicket of Alex Carey on day one of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: Government issues warning as mandatory registration for some NDIS providers confirmed
items.summary: The government confirms two categories of NDIS providers will be subject to mandatory registration, more than a year after it was handed recommendations for how to implement a new system.

items.title: The election is over, but inflation is still dominating the economic story
items.summary: Jim Chalmers has started his second term as treasurer just like the first one ended: trying to frame the budget on his terms, but with one eye on inflation.

items.title: AI-generated images of Bondi gunman used to spread false information
items.summary: AI-generated images of Bondi gunman Naveed Akram in the Philippines and a fabricated Facebook page are spreading online. And an image of police officers taken out of context is debunked by ABC NEWS Verify.

items.title: How well do you know 2025 arts award winners?
items.summary: The 2026 Oscars are just around the corner but let's give this year's arts award winners just a couple more moments in the sun.

items.title: Labor faces green 'Grinch' hospital funding accusations with a budget in the red
items.summary: Labor has two options when it comes to straddling a budget in the red and accusations it has become a green Grinch on health funding.

items.title: Warner Bros Discovery board rejects rival $163bn bid from Paramount
items.summary: In a letter to shareholders, the board wrote that Paramount had "consistently misled" Warner Bros shareholders that its $US30-per-share cash offer was fully guaranteed, or "backstopped," by the Ellison family,

items.title: Two men charged with murder after man shot in SA's wine region
items.summary: Two people have been charged with murder after a 62-year-old man was shot dead near South Australia's wine region of McLaren Vale on Wednesday evening.

items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Alex Carey's maiden Ashes ton rescues Australia, delights Adelaide and elevates his status
items.summary: Alex Carey looked to the heavens as his name rang out from the Adelaide Oval stands, his emotional century saving Australia's day one and furthering his push to one day stand among the great wicketkeeper-bats.

items.title: Teenager jailed after stabbing doctor at Tasmanian hospital in 2023
items.summary: A doctor went through a "lengthy, risky and complicated" surgery and continues to experience nightmares and flashbacks after being stabbed by a teenager he was treating in 2023, a court is told.

items.title: Day-night Tests locked in for Australian summer until 2031
items.summary: Cricket Australia CEO Todd Greenberg opens up on the future of day-night Tests in the future summer schedule.
